meanings.definition: Any of a class of mainly yellow, orange, or red fat-soluble pigments, including carotene, which give color to plant parts such as ripe tomatoes and autumn leaves.
meanings.sent1: The carotenoids in the ripe tomatoes made them look bright and colorful.
meanings.sent2: Autumn leaves get their vibrant hues from carotenoids present in them.
meanings.sent3: The carotenoids in the vegetables were having a party, painting everything in sight with their cheerful colors.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was like a canvas filled with carotenoids, each stroke adding a burst of warmth and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The carotenoids danced across the garden, turning everything they touched into a golden spectacle.

meanings.definition: A substance that is converted into vitamin A in the liver.
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in carotenoids can help your body produce vitamin A.
meanings.sent2: Carotenoids play a crucial role in the conversion process to vitamin A.
meanings.sent3: The carotenoids in the body were on a mission to become superheroes and transform into vitamin A.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like carotenoids, quietly working behind the scenes to bring about a powerful change.
meanings.sent5: The carotenoids acted as messengers, delivering the much-needed vitamin A to the liver.
